intro: Justicia trifolioides, commonly known as the flame flower, is a tropical shrub native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking, tubular red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators like hummingbirds and bees. The plant has opposite, trifoliate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil to prevent root rot. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
